column14: Processing of the MSH segment results in the creation of a new MessageHeader resource.

column9: If there is a source in MSH-4, or known based on the configuration.
column14: If the FHIR transformation does not yield a FHIR message, but only a set of resource (APIs, repository, etc.) than one should consider attaching this Provenance resource instance to the relevant FHIR resources generated.

If the FHIR transformation does not yield a FHIR Bunlde, but only a set of resource (APIs, repository, etc.) than one should consider attaching this Provenance resource instance to the relevant FHIR resources generated.

column9: If the software does represent not the original source system
If the software represents the original source system

column7: IF EVN-5 NOT VALUED AND (MSH-22 IS VALUED OR MSH-4 IS VALUED)
column14: If EVN-5 is not valued, then the MSH may have either the sending responsible organization (MSH-22) or the sending facility (MSH-4) to reasonable approximate the agent relevant for this Provenance instance.
Processing of the PID segment results in the creation of a new Patient resource

column9: One  may drop PID-33 from the condition if PID-34 Last Update Facility is still sufficient without a date.

column14: Incorporate PD1 content into the Patient created from the PID segment.

FHIR does not yet support field level security tags.  The ARV, when located with the PID/PD1 in the v2 message, is meant to only apply to the patient.  However, technically it could point to other places in the messageas as well.  That is considered out of scope as.

column7: IF ROL-3.1 EQUALS "PP" AND ROL-3.3 EQUALS "HL70443"
IF ROL-3.3 EQUALS "HL70443" AND ROL-3.1 IS NOT "PP"
column9: When the ROL includes entries with roles in Table HL70443 other than "PP", then they may be candidates for CareTeam, but not all.  That is implementation specific.

column14: Typically, each NK1 will be translated to either a new RelatedPerson resource or added as a new occurrence of Patient.contact, but it's possible to insert the NK1 data into both structures.
Processing of the PV1 segment results in the creation of a new Encounter resource
Incorporate PV2 content into the Encounter created from the PV1 segment.

FHIR does not yet support field level security tags.  The ARV, when located with the PV1/PV2 in the v2 message, is meant to only apply to the encounter.  However, technically it could point to other places in the messageas as well.  That is considered out of scope as.

column7: IF OBX-5 LST.count LESS THAN OR EQUALS 1 OR OBX-2 IS "NA"
column14: One cannot determine whether this observation made during the PV1/PV2 communicated above, or from a prior visit/stay. It is therefore up to the implementer whether to populate Observation.encounter.reference with the Encounter[1].id or not.  Only when the ADT message involves an event before the encounter occurs, e.g., the intiial registration, it is clear that the observation is NOT associated with Encounter[1].

column7: IF  OBX-5 LST.count GREATER THAN 1 AND OBX-2 IS NOT "NA"
column14: One cannot determine whether this observation made during the PV1/PV2 communicated above, or from a prior visit/stay. It is therefore up to the implementer whether to populate Observation.encounter.reference with the Encounter[1].id or not.  Only when the ADT message involves an event before the encounter occurs, e.g., the intiial registration, it is clear that the observation is NOT associated with Encounter[1].
Processing of the AL1 segment results in the creation of a new AllergyIntolerance resource

column9: If in context of the patient
column14: Processing of the DG1 segment results in the creation of a new Condition resource

column9: If in context of an encounter
If in context of a episode of care

column14: Processing of the IN1 segment results in the creation of a new Coverage resource
Incorporate IN3 content into the Coverage created from the IN1 segment.
